stream_context.summary: Kaze finishes the mutated-Yoshi boss prototype and the entire interior of Course 15’s spaceship, then begins blocking out the course’s Mario-64-style “retro section.” He also implements small engine fixes (rain shader, smoke particles) and discusses next steps once the main 15 courses are complete.

development_findings.summary: The Course 15 boss is a giant, mutated Yoshi whose tentacles slam mushrooms that the player must destroy; he also spawns drifting baby Yoshis (Zeina is animating them). Kaze must reduce the baby-Yoshi count and stop overlapping tentacle hits.
development_findings.quote: Right now they look like brain-dead zombies … This is entirely too many baby Yoshis. I need to reduce the amount he can spawn.

development_findings.summary: Kaze decides to scrap the current factory arena and move the fight to a small planet that the boss rips in half at the start (possible Beyblade-style drill). He will prototype a planet-breaking VFX and keep the Yoshi head visible in the planet’s core.
development_findings.quote: Instead of the factory, the Yoshi fight happens on an entire planet … He jumps up and drills into it, then parts of the planet fall off.

development_findings.summary: Spaceship interior is complete: computer room, specimen tanks, low-gravity shaft, engine room, observatory with holograms, and a glass-dome star that players see early to “edge” them.
development_findings.quote: I’ve come to realize it’s very important to constantly edge the player, so we show the star right at the start.

development_findings.summary: All 15 main courses are now modeled; once Course 15’s last sub-area is done the team will switch to polishing and side content.
development_findings.quote: After that we can finally move on to polishing content. Polishing is gonna feel so good after all this time.

development_findings.summary: Guest designers Hazer and Martiste will contribute bonus stages; Hazer’s demo is a pastel, flower-filled wind-slide level.
development_findings.quote: It’s very pastel-coloured … I think it’s very pretty. It’s missing a little bit of sauce, but it’s getting there.

development_findings.summary: Every course will contain a retro section; for Course 15 Kaze sketches floating slices of classic SM64 areas (Bob-omb Bridge, WF Tower, JRB ship, CCM slide, etc.) connected in space. RAM check shows ~0.5 MB free, so it should fit.
development_findings.quote: We’ll literally take a piece of each level and have it floating. I’ve just over half a megabyte left in RAM—honestly really good.

development_findings.summary: Engine tweaks: new full-texture rain shader; hot-tile smoke now spawns only when in view; particle system debugged after struct change.
Persistent bug: performing a BLJ can crash the game; likely an infinite loop or NULL read when the action state flips twice in one frame.
development_findings.quote: Somewhere there’s a code that probably loops forever; BLJ crashes. I gotta look into it.

development_findings.summary: Kaze keeps ROM size under 64 MB (currently 58.8 MB) and validates that layer-5 is now ‘transparent decal’ to fix draw-order issues.

context_findings.summary: Kaze pays an outside editor $5 per YouTube short and views the overtly mobile-ad style as humorous marketing.
context_findings.quote: Someone said, ‘I want to make shorts for you against pay.’ I told him, ‘Alright, $5 per short, go crazy.’

context_findings.summary: Prefers PayPal donations because YouTube takes a large cut, but PayPal alerts often fail, so he sometimes misses them.
context_findings.quote: When you donate via YouTube, YouTube takes a large cut. PayPal is a lot better, but I can miss it.

context_findings.summary: Mentions being sick, extremely busy, and unprepared for visiting family; balancing newborn, work, and stream.
context_findings.quote: My parents are coming tomorrow to look at the baby. I’m not prepared to have so many people here.

context_findings.summary: Design philosophy: opposes exhaustive option menus; fears feature creep and clutter.
context_findings.quote: People always ask for more and more options … I’d have an options menu with 260 items and it would be shit like ‘switch to old cap-block texture.’

biobak.summary: Critiques UV mapping and supports moving the boss arena to a planet; compliments hologram room.

badub.summary: Kaze plans to ask Badub for a ‘retro’ music medley for the SM64 section.
badub.quote: That would be really sick—I can suggest it to Badub.

zeina.summary: Animating the baby Yoshi minions for the Course 15 boss.
zeina.quote: Zeina’s currently animating them, so hopefully they will be better once they are animated.

key_stories.title: Mutated-Yoshi Boss Balancing
key_stories.summary: Kaze shows the off-stream prototype of the tentacle-slamming Yoshi boss. It looks visually impressive but spams baby-Yoshi minions and overlapping attacks, making it unfair.
key_stories.challenge: Fight is visually ready but mechanically overwhelming.
key_stories.process: Kaze demos the battle, identifies spam issues, and notes changes (reduce spawns, separate tentacles, wait for Zeina’s animations).
key_stories.outcome: Action items logged; balance pass will follow.
key_stories.key_quote: This is entirely too many baby Yoshis … the fight right now is too difficult in a global jank anyway.

key_stories.title: Factory to Planet Pivot
key_stories.summary: Chat (with Biobak) inspires replacing the factory arena with a small planet the boss destroys in a dramatic cut-scene.
key_stories.challenge: Existing factory set-piece felt dull and high-poly.
key_stories.process: Brainstorm live: drills, Beyblade spins, crack VFX, keep Yoshi head at center.
key_stories.outcome: Kaze writes a task: ‘Yoshi fight happens on a planet.’ VFX test planned next stream.
key_stories.key_quote: I hate that I have this whole factory here … Planet is cooler.

key_stories.title: Designing the Retro Section
key_stories.summary: Kaze needs a Mario-64 callback area for Course 15. He outlines a chain of floating dioramas—iconic slices of each SM64 course—while checking memory limits.
key_stories.challenge: Incorporate many references without blowing memory.
key_stories.process: Lists potential set pieces, sketches connections, checks free RAM (0.5 MB).
key_stories.outcome: Rough layout approved; work will start next stream.
key_stories.key_quote: We’ll literally just take a piece of each level and have it floating in space.

open_questions.context: Decided to move boss arena to a planet that splits apart, but details are undecided (drill, Beyblade spin, portals).
questions: What final method will Yoshi use to break the planet?
How will you implement the fracturing VFX within N64 limits?
Will the player fight on both halves or just the top shell?

open_questions.context: Kaze says the final boss is still ‘up for whatever we feel like,’ mentioning possibilities like Bowser mech or Yoshi-built weapon.
questions: Where does the design currently stand for the true final boss?
What narrative or thematic goals does the team want it to fulfill?
How will Yoshi labor and Bowser’s motives be reflected mechanically?

open_questions.context: Hazer and Martiste are making side levels independently.
questions: What criteria determine whether a guest level fits RTYI’s design ethos?
How will asset pipelines and quality control work between teams?
Will guest authors receive creative freedom or strict briefs?

open_questions.context: Kaze resists adding many options despite community requests.
questions: How does he balance minimalism with accessibility (e.g., control schemes, difficulty)?
Would he ever consider a ‘mod loader’ style compromise?

open_questions.context: Performing a BLJ can crash current builds; root cause unknown.
questions: What debugging steps will be taken to isolate the crash?
Is it tied to the new movement physics or memory?
Could it ship if unfixed, or will BLJ be officially supported?

open_questions.context: Kaze hints at a medley by Badub but nothing confirmed.
questions: What musical approach will link the floating SM64 dioramas?
Will the score be purely nostalgic or feature new motifs?
How will Badub emulate N64 compressions and instrument sets?
